FuncDef:
The rule command creates or modifies an ACL6 rule in the advanced ACL6 view.
The undo rule command deletes an ACL6 rule in the advanced ACL6 view. The rule command creates or modifies an ACL6 rule in the advanced ACL6 view. The undo rule command deletes an ACL6 rule in the advanced ACL6 view. By default, no advanced ACL6 rule is created.
CLIs: rule [ <rule-id> ] [ name <rule-name> ] { permit | deny } { hoport | <protocol> | gre | ipv6 | ipv6-ah | ipv6-esp | ospf | <7-16> | <18-57> | <59-255> | ipv6-frag | ipv6-routing | ipv6-destination } [ destination { <destination-ipv6-address> { <prefix-length> | <destination-wildcard> } | <dest-ipv6-addr-prefix> | any } | fragment | source { <source-ipv6-address> { <prefix-length> | <source-wildcard> } | <src-ipv6-addr-prefix> | any } | time-range <time-name> | dscp <dscp> | vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | logging ]

undo rule [ name <rule-name> ] { permit | deny } { hoport | <protocol> | gre | ipv6 | ipv6-ah | ipv6-esp | ospf | <7-16> | <18-57> | <59-255> | ipv6-frag | ipv6-routing | ipv6-destination } [ destination { <destination-ipv6-address> { <prefix-length> | <destination-wildcard> } | <dest-ipv6-addr-prefix> | any } | fragment | source { <source-ipv6-address> { <prefix-length> | <source-wildcard> } | <src-ipv6-addr-prefix> | any } | time-range <time-name> | dscp <dscp> | vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | logging ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an advanced ACL6 rule.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967294.

Specifies the name of an ACL rule.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces or begin with an underscore (_).

Permits the packets that match conditions.
-

Denies packets that match conditions.
-

Indicates the IPv6 hop-by-hop option.
-

Matches packets based on a protocol.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 5.

Indicates basic routing encapsulation (47).
-

Indicates any IPv6 protocol.
-

Indicates the IPv6 Authentication header (51).
-

Indicates IPv6 Security Payload Encapsulation (50).
-

Indicates the Open Shortest Path First routing protocol (89).
-

Indicates the protocol number.
The value is an integer ranging from 7 to 16.

Matches packets based on destination IPv6 addresses.
If destination is not configured, packets to any destination IPv6 address are matched.
-

Specifies a destination IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the mask length of an IPv6 address..
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

Specifies the IPv6 destination address with a prefix.
The value is a string case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Indicates any IPv6 address.
-

Checks fragmented packets.
-

Matches packets based on the source IPv6 address.
If no source IPv6 address is configured, packets with any source IPv6 address are matched.
-

Specifies the source IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the mask length of the destination IPv6 address.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

Specifies a time range during which a rule takes effect. If time-range is not configured, the rule takes effect immediately.
A time range is configured using the time-range command.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

Specifies the value of  DSCP.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.

Matches packets based on an IPv6 VPN instance name. If the traffic is from L3VPN, this option must be configured in the ACL. If this option is not configured, the traffic belongs to the public network rather than L3VPN.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters.

Logs matched packets.
-

Specifies an ACL6 rule.
-

Indicates the protocol number.
The value is an integer ranging from 18 to 57.

Indicates the protocol number.
The value is an integer ranging from 59 to 255.

Specifies the wildcard of a destination IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the wildcard mask of a source IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo: After an advanced ACL6 is created, run the rule command to add rules to the ACL6.
